intro: Myosotis brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. It has short, broad leaves and produces numerous seed capsules that disperse its seeds by wind. Myosotis brevifolia is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological importance in its native habitat.
